message.content: {"id": "6125", "title": "Bug 6125: JAR packager reports open files very late", "description": "When pressing 'Finish' in the JAR packager, the following error occurs: 'JAR creation failed: Unsaved Editors'5.", "OB": "The JAR packager is not allowing the creation of a JAR file with unsaved editors. If there are open files that have unsaved changes, the packager should either allow the creation of the JAR file or display a dialog prompting the user to save the changes.", "EB": "The JAR packager should allow the creation of a JAR file even if there are open files with unsaved changes. If there are unsaved changes, the packager should display a dialog prompting the user to save them before proceeding with the JAR creation. If the user chooses not to save the changes, the packager should proceed with the JAR creation using the unsaved editors.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 1. Open a file and make changes without saving. 2. Open the JAR packager for the corresponding project. 3. Fill in all the required fields (path, destination, name, description, etc.) in the packager. 4. Attempt to create the JAR file. "}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '6125', 'title': 'Bug 6125JAR packager reports open files very late', 'description': "press finish: 'JAR creation failed: Unsaved Editors'5. ", 'OB': '', 'EB': 'To save, I have to quit the wizard, save, open the wizard again and thenenter all fields again I should be allowed to create a JAR with unsaved editors If not, there should be a dialog to allow saving ', 'SR': "1. edit in a file, don't save2. open the JAR packager on it's project3. enter all path, destination, name of jar packager description, etc4. "}
